title: Bug 31627 - Core Dump When Changing Perspective with DBCS Project
description: This bug report describes a core dump issue that occurs when switching perspectives in Eclipse after adding a DBCS (Double-Byte Character Set) project to the workspace. The problem is observed in a Japanese language environment running on RedHat 8 with GTK 2.2 and IBM JDK 1.3.1.
OB: The observed behavior section lacks specific details. Please provide a clear description of what happens when the core dump occurs.
EB: The expected behavior is that changing perspectives, especially to the 'Resource Perspective,' should be successful without causing a core dump or any errors.
SR:
To reproduce the issue, follow these steps:
1. Create a project using DBCS characters.
2. Right-click on the project and select 'Team' > 'Share Project...'
3. Select the CVS repository.
4. Choose the option 'Use project name as module name' and click 'Finish.'
5. Select the project in the Synchronize view.
6. Right-click on the project and choose 'Add Version Control.'
7. Right-click on the project and select 'Commit.'
8. Right-click on the project and select 'Delete' (Choose 'also delete contents under /workspace folder name').
9. Change the perspective to the 'CVS Perspective.'
10. Expand the repository and HEAD.
11. Right-click on the DBCS project and select 'Check Out As Project.'
